security: Disclosing the existence and specific functions of the Official Cover and Liaison Section (OCL/CCD), the use of the U.S. Army Element, Joint Operations Group for cover, and the handling of Unit ID cards could compromise cover operations. For example: “All information concerning this cover arrangement is available in the Official Cover and Liaison Section, CCD… Subject has been issued Unit ID Card No. 1205 for domestic use only.”
summary: A memo regarding the establishment of official cover backstopping for Guy VITATE using the U.S. Army Element, Joint Operations Group, with instructions for managing associated documentation and notifications.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET memorandum, dated May 11, 1960, from Joseph M. Adams, Chief of Official Cover & Liaison (OCL/CCD), to the Chief of EE, concerns the establishment of official cover for Guy VITATE, utilizing the U.S. Army Element, Joint Operations Group. It outlines procedures for managing cover-related information, notifications to OCL/CCD when cover is no longer required, and the handling of Unit ID Card No. 1205 issued to VITATE, with specific arrangements involving the Offices of Security and Personnel for PCS moves, TDY trips, and resignations to ensure proper documentation control.
title: Establishment of Official Cover Backstop
